channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Two Democratic Governors Say if Texas Redraws Congressional Maps, They May Too

item.title: Taiwan’s Mass Recall Vote Tests Its Democracy, and China’s Nerves
item.description: An unprecedented recall vote could hand President Lai Ching-te more power by ousting legislative opponents. It could also prompt a response from China...

item.title: The Gen Z New Yorkers Selling Their Parents on Mamdani
item.description: Young voters went for Zohran Mamdani by a large margin. Can they persuade their parents to do the same?

item.title: War Amputees Find New Purpose on the Golf Course
item.description: The sport helps Ukrainian soldiers who have lost limbs in the war against Russia to heal and to master their prosthetics, rehabilitation experts say.

item.title: Thailand Warns of War With Cambodia as Deadly Clashes Enter 2nd Day
item.description: More than 100,000 people have been displaced in the deadliest conflict between the two nations in 14 years.

item.title: Trump defeats Australia’s mad cow disease restrictions in deal to ship American beef overseas
item.description: The Trump's administration claimed it as a major victory over “non-scientific trade barriers.”

item.title: Intel plans to slash 25,000 jobs in 2025 as new CEO warns, ‘There are no more blank checks’
item.description: CEO Lip-Bu Tan sent a memo informing employees of significant ongoing layoffs and cost-cutting.

item.title: S&P 500 sets 5 all-time highs in one trading week
item.description: On Friday, the Dow Jones Industrial Average rose 0.5%, and the Nasdaq composite added 0.2% to its own record set the day before.
